questions.question: What is the definition of an event?
options: Any financially valuable component that can contribute to the delivery of an IT product or Service
Any change of state that has significance for the management of a service or other configuration item
An unplanned interruption to a service or reduction in the quality of a service
Any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver an IT service
questions.answer: Any change of state that has significance for the management of a service or other configuration item

explanation.Any financially valuable component that: Incorrect: that is an IT asset.
explanation.Any change of state that has significanc: Correct: ITIL definition of an event.
explanation.Any component that needs to be managed i: Incorrect: that is a configuration item.

questions.question: Which practice performs reviews to ensure that services continue to meet the needs of customers?
Which of the four dimensions focuses on roles, responsibilities, and systems of authority?
Which practice guarantees that users have a range of access channels to choose from to report problems?

explanation.Service desk: Correct: provides multiple access channels for users.
explanation.Incident management: Incorrect: restores service; intake is via the service desk.

questions.question:
Identify the missing word in the following sentence

The purpose of the problem management practice is to reduce the likelihood and impact of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents and managing workarounds and (?)

explanation.Changes: Incorrect: assessed and authorized via change enablement.
explanation.Known errors: Correct: analyzed problems not yet resolved.

questions.question: Which is recommended as part of the 'progress iteratively with feedback' guiding principle?
options: Organize work into small manageable units
Analyze the whole situation in detail before taking any action
Prohibit changes to plans after they have been finalized
Reduce the number of steps that produce tangible results
questions.answer: Organize work into small manageable units

explanation.Organize work into small manageable unit: Correct: iterate in small steps and use feedback.
explanation.Reduce the number of steps that produce: Not the core of this principle.

questions.question: Which is a financially valuable component that can contribute to the delivery of a service?

explanation.Configuration item: Incorrect: CI may or may not be financially valued as an asset.
explanation.IT asset: Correct: financially valuable component used in service delivery.

questions.question: What is a problem?
options: Any change of state that has significance for the management of a configuration item
An unplanned reduction in the quality of a service (Incident)
Cause or potential cause of one or more incidents
An addition or modification that could have an effect on services (Change)
questions.answer: Cause or potential cause of one or more incidents

questions.question: What is the MOST LIKELY reason that incident management would need a temporary team to work together?
options: To resolve a complex or major incident
To escalate an incident to a supplier or partner
So users can resolve their own incidents with self-help
So customers and users are provided with timely updates
questions.answer: To resolve a complex or major incident

explanation.To resolve a complex or major incident: Correct: major incidents often need cross-functional swarming.
explanation.To escalate an incident to a supplier or: Escalation may be done by the service desk/IM, not a temp team.
explanation.So users can resolve their own incidents: Self-help reduces load but not major incident resolution.

questions.question: What is the customer of a service responsible for?
options: Defining the requirements for the service
Authorizing the budget for the service
questions.answer: Defining the requirements for the service

explanation.Defining the requirements for the servic: Correct: customer defines requirements and owns outcomes.

questions.question: Which practice provides a single point of contact for users?
Which is included in the purpose of the improve value chain activity?
options: Ensures a shared understanding of the vision, current status, and improvement direction for all four dimensions and all products and services across an organization.
Ensures continual improvement of products, services, and practices across all value chain activities and the four dimensions of service management.
Ensures products and services continually meet stakeholder expectations for quality, costs, and time to market.
Ensures a good understanding of stakeholder needs, transparency, and continual engagement and good relationships with all stakeholders.
questions.answer: Ensures continual improvement of products, services, and practices across all value chain activities and the four dimensions of service management.

questions.question: Which term is used to describe removing something that could have an effect on a service?

explanation.A change: Correct: addition, modification or removal affecting services.
explanation.An incident: Incorrect: unplanned interruption or reduction in quality.

questions.question: A user wants to know how to create a report, so they come into contact with the service desk. Which practice is MOST LIKELY to help with the solution of this issue?

explanation.Service request management: Correct: request for information or access is a standard request.

questions.question: Which practice is the responsibility of everyone in the organization?

explanation.Problem management: Incorrect: specialized roles analyze root causes.
explanation.Service level management: Incorrect: SLM team engages customers and metrics.

questions.question: What is used as a tool to help define and measure performance?

explanation.A change schedule: Incorrect: plans changes and avoids conflicts.
explanation.A service level agreement: Correct: defines targets and measures performance.

questions.question: Which is described by the 'organizations and people' dimension of service management?

explanation.Communication and collaboration: Correct: people aspects of service management.

questions.question: What type of change is often used for resolving incidents or implementing security patches?

explanation.Emergency change: Correct: implemented as soon as possible.

questions.question: How is a 'continual improvement register' used?
options: To authorize changes to implement improvement initiatives
To organize past, present, and future improvement ideas
To provide a structured approach to implementing improvements
To record requests for provision of a resource or service
questions.answer: To organize past, present, and future improvement ideas

explanation.To organize past, present, and future im: Correct: CIR captures and prioritizes ideas.

questions.question: When working on an improvement iteration, which concept helps to ensure that the iteration activities remain appropriate in changing circumstances?

explanation.Direct observation: Helpful input, but feedback loops steer iterations.
explanation.Feedback loop: Correct: keeps actions aligned as conditions change.
explanation.Minimum viable product: Delivery tactic, not the steering mechanism.

questions.question: Which practice ensures that service actions, that are normal part of service delivery are effectively handled?
Which value chain activity communicates the current status of all four dimensions of service management?

explanation.Improve: Incorrect: ensures continual improvement across activities.
explanation.Obtain/build: Incorrect: ensures components are available and meet specs.
explanation.Engage: Incorrect: manages stakeholder needs and interactions.
explanation.Plan: Correct: communicates current status and direction.

questions.question: Which TWO types of components are MOST important for Service Desk staff?

explanation.Knowledge of business processes: Correct: understand how users work to support them effectively.
explanation.Collaboration skills: Correct: coordinate across teams and communicate clearly.
explanation.Advanced technical knowledge: Helpful but not essential for all desk roles.
explanation.Workflow design skills: Not core to day-to-day desk operations.

questions.question: A service will be unavailable for the next two hours for unplanned maintenance. Which practice is MOST LIKELY to be involved in managing this?
What should remain constant within an organization even when the organizations objective change?

explanation.Outputs: Incorrect: vary with services and processes.
explanation.Guiding principles: Correct: durable recommendations in all circumstances.

questions.question: Which practice balances management of risk with maximizing throughput?

explanation.Change enablement: Correct: assesses risk while enabling successful changes.
explanation.Continual improvement: Incorrect: aligns practices with changing needs.
explanation.Problem management: Incorrect: reduces likelihood and impact of incidents.

questions.question: Which role submits service requests?
options: The supplier, or their authorized representative
The user, or their authorized representative
The sponsor, or their authorized representative
The customer, or their authorized representative
questions.answer: The user, or their authorized representative

questions.question: What is MOST LIKELY to be handled as a service request?
options: Providing a virtual server for a development team
An emergency change to apply a security patch
Managing an interruption to a service
questions.answer: Providing a virtual server for a development team

questions.question: Which of the following statements about 'outcomes' is TRUE?
options: Outcomes provide assurance to stakeholders regarding the performance of a service
The level of expenses regarding a technology for a service is defined by an outcome
An outcome depends on at least one output to deliver a result
The delivery of products to a stakeholder is enabled by outcomes
questions.answer: An outcome depends on at least one output to deliver a result

explanation.The delivery of products to a stakeholde: Incorrect: outputs deliverables are used to achieve outcomes.

questions.question: Which practice MOST requires staff to demonstrate skills such as empathy and emotional intelligence?

explanation.Problem management: Incorrect: analytical and creative skills are key.
explanation.Service desk: Correct: frontline staff need empathy and EI.

questions.question: Which is a potential benefit of using an IT service management tool to support the 'incident management' practice?
options: It may ensure that the cause of incidents is identified within agreed times
It may provide automated resolution and closure of complex incidents
It may ensure that supplier contracts are aligned with the needs of the service provider
It may provide automated matching of incidents to problems or known errors
questions.answer: It may provide automated matching of incidents to problems or known errors

explanation.It may ensure that the cause of incident: Incorrect: tools assist but cannot ensure RCA times.
explanation.It may provide automated resolution and: Incorrect: complex incidents typically need experts.

questions.question: What is a standard change?
options: A change that is well understood, fully documented and pre-authorized
A change that doesn't need a risk assessment because it is required to resolve an incident
A change that is assessed, authorized, and scheduled as part of 'continual improvement
A change that needs to be assessed, authorized, and scheduled by a change authority
questions.answer: A change that is well understood, fully documented and pre-authorized

questions.question: Which is correct about change authorization?
options: Emergency changes are authorized by the technician making the change
Assignment of the change authorization is based on the change type and model
The change authority will ensure changes are authorised after they are deployed
A change authority is assigned each time a standard change is requested
questions.answer: Assignment of the change authorization is based on the change type and model

explanation.Emergency changes are authorized by the: Incorrect: emergency authorization is expedited but still governed.

questions.question: What is the definition of change?
options: To add, modify or remove anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on services
To move new or changed hardware, software, or any other component to live environments
To ensure that accurate and reliable information about the configuration of services is available
To make new and changed services and features available for use
questions.answer: To add, modify or remove anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on services

explanation.To add, modify or remove anything that c: Correct: ITIL definition of a change.

questions.question: Which would be supported by the 'service request management' practice?
options: A request to authorize a change that could have an effect on a service
A request from a user for something which is a normal part of service delivery
A request to restore service after a service interruption
A request to investigate the cause of multiple related incidents
questions.answer: A request from a user for something which is a normal part of service delivery

questions.question: Which of the following practices suggests that organizations should develop competencies in methodologies and techniques, like SWOT (strength, weakness, opportunity and threat) analysis and balanced scorecard review, in order to meet their needs?

explanation.Continual improvement: Correct: encourages use of techniques like SWOT and scorecards.

questions.question: Which is the MOST LIKELY way of resolving major incidents?
options: The service desk identifying the cause and a resolution
A support team following detailed procedures for investigating the incident
A temporary team working together to identify a resolution
Users establishing a resolution using self-help
questions.answer: A temporary team working together to identify a resolution

explanation.A support team following detailed proced: May help, but cross-functional coordination is typical.

questions.question: Which TWO BEST describe the guiding principles?

explanation.2. Standards: Incorrect: they are recommendations, not mandates.
explanation.3. Recommendations: Correct: they guide decisions and actions.
explanation.4. Long-term: Correct: applicable over time and circumstances.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about change authorization is CORRECT?
options: The change type and model is the basis for assigning the change authority
Every time a standard change is requested a change authority is assigned
Ensuring that changes are authorized after their deployment is done by the change authority
The technician making an emergency change can authorize such changes
questions.answer: The change type and model is the basis for assigning the change authority

explanation.The technician making an emergency chang: Incorrect: emergency authorization is expedited but governed.

questions.question: Which is the FIRST thing to consider when focusing on value?
options: Understanding what is valuable to the service consumer
Identifying the service consumer who will receive value
Ensuring value is co-created by improvement initiatives
Defining customer experience and user experience
questions.answer: Identifying the service consumer who will receive value

explanation.Understanding what is valuable to the se: Follows after identifying who the consumer is.
explanation.Identifying the service consumer who wil: Correct: know who is being served first.
explanation.Defining customer experience and user ex: Further refinement once the consumer is known.
